refnamediv.refpurpose: define the set of parameters for a SOLT standard such as C0 for the "open" standard.

listitem.para: tlist containing the parameter of the standard (see uW_cal_standard).
string defining the standard : "O", "S" or "L" correspounding respectively for "Open", "Short" or "Load".
constant numerical value defining the standard.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function generates a tlist which contain all the data of a calibration standard in order to use this information with "uW_cal_standard" function. This function can include delay or losses informations. Those data must appear in the input parameter as a string. Notice that the offset is NOT a parameter. If your Calkit is described with an offset, please convert it in a delay before using this function with "uW_cal_mm2s".

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Scattering parameter matrix to Cascade matrix convertion for 2 ports matrix.

listitem.para: time in seconds correspounding to the offset length l.
standard offset length in millimeters.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function converts a standard offset length (millimeter) into a standard delay (second).

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: generate the S1P form of a standard according the definition parameters.

listitem.para: tlist containing the parameter of the standard (see uW_cal_define_standard).
column vector of frequencies (in Hertz).
S1P object. This is the reflexion coefficent of the standard for the given frequencies.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function generates the S1P object of a calibration standard.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Load-pull measurement de-embedding .

listitem.para: String parameter : filename of the input CST file (IV-CAD load-pull file format before de-embedding) including the path.
String parameter : filename of the output CST file (IV-CAD load-pull file format after de-embedding) including the path.
tlist containing the S parameters (S2P : 2 ports) located between the input port and the DUT.
tlist containing the S parameters (S2P : 2 ports) located between the DUT and the output port.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function read a CST file and de-embed each RF measured wave according the two S2P file located before and after the DUT.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: S2P measurements de-embedding .

listitem.para: S2P Object (tlist) containing the complete chain S2P parameters.
S2P Object (tlist) containing the de-embedded S2P parameters. The S2P of the DUT.
tlist containing the S parameters (S2P : 2 ports) located between the input port and the DUT.
tlist containing the S parameters (S2P : 2 ports) located between the DUT and the output port.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function de-embed a S2P data (S_Total) according to the input and output S2P blocks. The result is the de-embedded S2P data.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Plot graph from IV measurements curves (MES file)

listitem.para: Measurements object. Refer to the uW_MES_read() function
Integer value. The number of the network you want to plot.
Sting value. The X axis of your plot. Basically my_x="v2".
Sting value. The Y axis of your plot. Basically my_x="i2".
This function plots the data included into your MES object. You can plot :
- Classical I-V curves : my_x="v2" and my_y="i2";
- Gm extracted from small signal multi biases optimization : my_x="v2" and my_y="Gm";
- Derivates from I-V curves extracted with X : my_x="v2" and my_y="di2dv1";
and much more...
(my_x="v2

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Display either S1P or S2P scilab object in the current graphic window as a VNA.

listitem.para: S1P or S2P scilab object (tlist). If the user wants to display several objects, each one has to include the same frequency grid and the same port number.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function displays S1P or S2P data as a classical vectorial network analyser (VNA). S11 and S22 are displayed on a smith chart. S11 is located on top left. S22 is located on bottom right. S21 and S12 are displayed as magnitude (dB) vs frequency (GHz) and phase (degree) versus frequency (GHz). S21 is displayed on bottom left and S12 is displayed on top right.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Plot the stability circles from S2P data.

listitem.para: 2 ports S2P data

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function plots the stability circles on a smith chart into the current graphic window. Input stability circles are blue. Output stability circles are red. The frequency list is the one embedded in the S2P data.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Plot the smith chart in the current graphic window.

listitem.para: vector of the normalized impedance to display. Most VNA use impedances=[.2 .5 1 2 5];
numerical value of the color which be used to trace the smith chart.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function plot the smith chart into the current graphic window.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Plot the smith chart in the current graphic window with vectorial arcs.

listitem.para: vector of the normalized impedance to display. Most VNA use impedances=[.2 .5 1 2 5];
numerical value of the color which be used to trace the smith chart.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function plots the smith chart into the current graphic window with vectorial arcs. Well suited for fig or eps exports.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Generate a CITIfile from a MES file (*.mes) from XLIM measurements

listitem.para: String parameter : filename of the MES file including the path (XLIM IV curves file format).
String parameter : filename of the CITI file including the path for Agilent ADS.
This function transform a MES+MPS data of a network in a CITIfile for ADS.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: quiescent point informations for a selected IV measurement file (*.mes) network

listitem.para: the vector containing information of the network number n.
dataset containing the IV curves informations for Scilab.
integer. Number of the selected network.
This function analyse a MES data set in order to obtain the quiescent bias point information of a selected network.
The output vector is the following one :
[v1,i1,v2,i2,T] with - v1 : input voltage
- v2 : output voltage
- i1 : input current
- i2 : output current
- T : Chuck temperature (K)

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Plot graph from IV measurements curves (MES file)

listitem.para: Measurements object. Refer to the uW_MES_read() function
Integer value. The number of the network you want to plot.
Sting value. The X axis of your plot. Basically my_x="v2".
Sting value. The Y axis of your plot. Basically my_x="i2".
This function plots the data included into your MES object. You can plot :
- Classical I-V curves : my_x="v2" and my_y="i2";
- Gm extracted from small signal multi biases optimization : my_x="v2" and my_y="Gm";
- Derivates from I-V curves extracted with X : my_x="v2" and my_y="di2dv1";
and much more...
(my_x="v2

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: read IV measurement file (*.mes) from XLIM measurements

listitem.para: the filename of the MES file (XLIM IV curves file format).
dataset containing the IV curves informations for Scilab.
This function read a MES file in order to manage informations within it with Scilab. You can acces to some data as follow :
dataset.network(number of network).curve(number of curve).plot(number of plot).field
field can be :
- v1 : input voltage
- v2 : output voltage
- i1 : input current
- i2 : output current
- S2P : index of the S2P file index
- di1dv1 : Derivate value if available into the file
- di1dv2
- di2dv1
- di2dv2
- Cgs : intrinsic value from linear modeling
- Cgd
- Gm
- Gd
- Cds
- Ri
- Tau
- Rgd

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Display a dialog box to select a measured network

listitem.para: MES object obtain with a uW_MES_read() function.
Integer. Number of the selected network.
This function generates a dialog box in order to let the user select a network within a complete MES file. Each line in the dialog box describe a network as follow :
Add here a paragraph of the function description

refsection.programlisting: Add here scilab instructions and comments

S parameter object extracted from the mps file.
This function extract a S2P from a mps filename and the desired index (3 capitals letters).

refsection.para: This function write S parameter data into a S1P file.

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Scattering parameter matrix to Hybrid matrix convertion for 2 ports matrix.

listitem.para: tlist containing the S parameters.
tlist containing the H parameters calculated from the S parameters.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function convert a S parameter object into a H parameter one. It works only for 2 ports devices (S2P).

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the determinant of an S2P file.

listitem.para: tlist containing the S parameters.
vector. Value of the determinant according to the frequency list of the S2P object.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function calculates the determinant of a S2P objet S as follow : D=S.S11*S.S22-S.S12*S.S21. The condition of unconditional stability is achieved when K greater than 1 and abs(D) lower than 1 with : K=uW_S2P_K(S) and D=uW_S2P_DELTA(S).

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the stability K factor.

listitem.para: tlist containing the S parameters.
vector. Value of the K stability factor according to the frequency list of the S2P object.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function calculates the K factor. The condition of unconditional stability is achieved when K greater than 1 and abs(D) lower than 1 with : K=uW_S2P_K(S) and D=uW_S2P_DELTA(S).

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the Maximum Available Gain (MAG) of a S2P.

listitem.para: tlist containing the S parameters.
vector. Value of the Maximum Available Gain according to the frequency list of the S2P object.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function calculates the Maximum Available Gain (MAG) of a S2P object. This gain is defined ONLY for K greater than 1 with : K=uW_S2P_K(S). This function returns MAG=0 for K lower than 1.

refsection.title: Examples

listitem.para: www.reveyrand.fr

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the Maximum Stable Gain (MSG) of a S2P.

listitem.para: tlist containing the S parameters.
vector. Value of the Maximum Stable Gain according to the frequency list of the S2P object.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function calculates the Maximum Stable Gain (MSG) of a S2P object. This gain is defined ONLY for K lower than 1 with : K=uW_S2P_K(S). This function returns MAG=0 for K greater than 1.

refsection.title: Examples

refsection.para: This function convert flip a S parameter object. Port1 and port 2 are switched such as S2.S11=S1.S22, S2.S22=S1.S11, S2.S12=S1.S21, and S2.S21=S1.S12.

S2P file has to include bias values V1, V2, I1 and I2 in comments lines as follow :
# HZ S MA R 50
